comment: I took this over the summer and she was so helpful. She always sent out reminders for when assignments were due and the tests and assignments were very straightforward. 10/10

ES 2300 with Professor McLester was phenomenal! ES 2300 overall is an easy course, especially if you already took A&P 1 or 2. The chapter assignments, although short, help with practice and memorization. The quizzes and exams are timed, but there's enough time to answer each question and think it through if necessary.

TAKE PROF MCLESTER FOR ONLINE 2300!!!!! Very easy and simple. Have 3-5 small activities to do in the textbook per week and a weekly quizzes. 2 exams that are similar to quizzes. Both quizzes and exams are not lockdown, so no need to feel rushed or nervous. There is a timer though, but if you study the material, you'll breeze through it.
Her online course was easy and straight to the point. No lockdown browser for quizzes or exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: If she is your online professor, she is super quick to grade and always gives feedback when needed. She answers emails promptly and is very understanding.
hardest class ive ever taken in my life - its what made me switch my major. she's an ok teacher but is extremely unapproachable and snappy.
Heavy lecture I would not take again.She is very snapy and doesn't teach properly to understand the material.

She is literally the best professor she truly will care for you. Don't miss a single lecture her test questions are from her lectures. 3 exams, a final exam, and 4 quizzes. she might seem intimidating but if you get to know her and talk to her one-on-one she is very caring!
*TIP: record her lectures to re-write notes later with her audio HELPS
She is not a great teacher. The class is an eye-opener for sure. However, she does not prepare you well and leaves you in the dark. Don't take unless you absolutely have to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: ES 3900 was a difficult course, but Dr. McLester was very knowledgeable and gave good feedback in order to succeed! My advice would be to STUDY STUDY STUDY. Try to review each lecture the night after class. I studied my butt off for the final and ended up doing really well! Her quizzes and tests can be challenging, but she isn't trying to trick you

She will make you work for your grade! This class was a wake up call for my ES degree. Attendance is not mandatory but if you miss class you're missing a lot of information that's not on the slides. Make sure to write everything she talks about in class. 3 tests, 1 cumulative final, and 4 quizzes. She gave us extra credit for our final! STUDY!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: This class will be an eye-opener for those looking to pursue the exercise science major. That isn't to say it is Dr. McLester's fault, it is just the content of the class. She definitely knows how to teach this class, she also grades fast & replies quickly if you have a question.

Dr. McLester is amazing! She's incredibly knowledgeable and is prepared to answer any questions you have. Attendance isn't mandatory, but she does keep track of it. She gives a lot of important info during class so I would recommend going. Her tests are pretty straight forward. If you study and take good lecture notes you'll do great!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Professor McLester is a great professor and really cares about her students, but she really makes you work hard for a good grade! There are several exams, quizzes and a cumulative final. This is a difficult course due to the material but McLester answers questions really well!

Dr. McLester is an amazing Exercise Science Professor. She has been my favorite so far in the program. 3900 is quite difficult. You have to put the time in with studying or you will struggle. You have to learn this material as it carries over for the rest of the program. McLester cares about her students and she will provide any help she can.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I took her online for Health and Fitness Management and she was great! Gave good feedback. halfways through the semester, I did end up needing the book which sucked because it was barely necessary cause she goes over everything for the tests.

She is extremely lecture heavy, You wont pass her class skipping and studying her powerpoints. I did not read the book but I will assume the book will help you supplement what she teaches but her test and quizzes are DIRECTLY from lecture and especially anything she writes on the board. Even the most random things she says will show up as bonus.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Disorganized and rambles, brags, isnt clear what she expects from you on test, her lectures are based off of her talking and board writing but does not put up anything on d2l for you. Doesnt do any videos of what she expects you to memorize but itll show up on your test worth like 12 points. Her tests are also fill in the blank no word bank.

By far one of the worst/most self centered professors I have ever taken. She is terrible at explaining and only wants to show off how much she knows. Enjoys being the smartest in the room but I think she forgot that she is a professor and it is expected of her. Talks about the students she doesnt like very openly. Not very professional.

She is one of the nicest, positive, and brightest professors I've met. No one other than her should be teaching HFM with the knowledge and credibility she carries. You don't even have to show up and still make an A. 3 tests (last one is a non cumulative final), 4 HW assignments. She brings in guest speakers - so helpful, made me switch careers!

This class is fairly easy, I barely showed up and made an A. She picks favorites and only focused on a couple people in class which was annoying to me. There are a couple papers that you need the book for. I made mid B's on the tests and pulled out an A in the class. Class is fine just not my favorite professor.

Online class has an incredible workload and her tests are impossible.  Not enough time to do tests online as you must know the answer within 10 secondds of reading the questions.  Don't take this class online.  Much easier in the classroom.

Medical Terminology was extremely easy with her! The class is online and it's an EASY A. It is a little tedious but one you realize how easy the work is, the class is such a breeze. She's extremely nice and is there if you have any questions.

I looked forward to her class every day (Summer) and looked forward to class discussions. Her tests are over her PowerPoint, which can be printed from home, and her assignmentsprojects require the book. You wont need the book for the tests, so if you can borrow one for the assignments, then you wont need to buy or rent it. Great professor!

Dr. McLester is amazing! Two test, two assignments, and participation. I didn't open the book until the assignments. Study her powerpoints and notes for the tests and pay attention in class. Her lectures are great and she is very good at explaining things in simple terms. She doesn't grade the assignments too harshly; just follow the directions.
